ngiemboon: À kǔu ndá ńgyá mezsǒ mé nuŋe sate sate.
en: He came in and saw his clothes lying in a mess.
that of (possessive pronoun referring back to class 5 nouns)
those of (possessive pronoun referring back to class 8 nouns)

ngiemboon: Lenÿɔ́g mêngáb pɔ́ se múɔ ne ńgyáŋa.
en: The hen's eye and that of the chick are sick.

ngiemboon: À ge kaa pɔ̀ɔn sé pɔ́ se tá we.
en: He will carry his bags and those of his father.

ngiemboon: Pi tó ḿbí se Tâm ńdɔg ńtó.
en: Come take for Tam to bring.

his (third person singular possessive adjective modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)

ours (first person plural exclusive pronoun referring back to class 5 and 8 nouns)

our (first person plural exclusive adjective modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)

our (first person plural exclusive emphatic adjective modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)

ngiemboon: Tè kwɛ́ legwaʼá shú té kwɛ́ ség.
en: Don’t attach your shelf without attaching ours.
yours and ours (first person plural inclusive possessive pronoun referring back to class 5 and 8 nouns)
yours and ours (first person plural inclusive possessive pronoun referring back to class 5 and 8 nouns)

your and our (first person plural inclusive emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn shʉ́a lepfo, á ná ségè.
en: If he splits the cola, he gives us ours.

ngiemboon: À nǎ lelÿɔʼ né mèŋ pɔ́ sélémɔʼɔ́.
en: He only gave me a yam.
